Class BudgetFiles

BudgetFiles class is used to manage the files used in the Budget project.

Inheritance
System.Object
BudgetFiles
Inherited Members
System.Object.ToString()
System.Object.Equals(System.Object)
System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.GetHashCode()
System.Object.GetType()
System.Object.MemberwiseClone()
Namespace: Budget
Assembly: HomeBudget.dll
Syntax
public class BudgetFiles

Methods

VerifyReadFromFileName(String, String)

Verifies if you can read from a file and returns the file path. It receives 2 string values as arguments (FilePath and DefaultFileName). If FilePath is null, it will set the value to a file path with the file name DefaultFileName and It will return the value of FilePath if it exists.

Declaration
public static string VerifyReadFromFileName(string FilePath, string DefaultFileName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String FilePath

The file path of the file to read from
System.String DefaultFileName

The default file name given to file path if FilePath is null
Returns
Type Description
System.String

The valid file path will be returned if it exists
Remarks

The default filepath that will be used if FilePath is null consists of a given filepath and a file name(DefaultFileName).

Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

BudgetFiles files = new BudgetFiles();

//Calls method to verify read from filepath and stores return value in GoodFilePath.
String GoodFilePath = files.VerifyReadFromFileName(FilePath, DefaultFileName)

//Outputs the file path received from the previous method to the console.
Console.WriteLine(GoodFilePath)
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.IO.FileNotFoundException

Thrown when FilePath does not exist

VerifyWriteToFileName(String, String)

Verifies if you can write to a file and returns the file path. It receives 2 string values as arguments (FilePath and DefaultFileName). If FilePath is null, it will set the value to a file path with the file name DefaultFileName by creating the necessary directories. It will then verify if the directory and file exists. The method will finally check if you can write to the file.

Declaration
public static string VerifyWriteToFileName(string FilePath, string DefaultFileName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String FilePath

The file path of the file to write in
System.String DefaultFileName

Default filename given to filepath if FilePath is null
Returns
Type Description
System.String

The valid file path will be returned if you could write to the file
Remarks

The default filepath that will be used if FilePath is null consists of a given filepath and a file name(DefaultFileName).

Examples

The example shown below shows the usage of this method: 

BudgetFiles files = new BudgetFiles();

//Calls method to verify write to filepath and stores return value in GoodFilePath.
String GoodFilePath = files.VerifyWriteToFileName(FilePath, DefaultFileName)

//Outputs the file path received from the previous method to the console.
Console.WriteLine(GoodFilePath)
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.Exception

Thrown when FilePath does not exist or when FilePath is read-only meaning that you cannot write in the file.
